revised_title: Investigation of Self-Diffusion in Molten Sodium Chloride and Nernst-Einstein Equation
tldr: The authors determined the self-diffusion coefficients of sodium and chlorine ions in molten sodium chloride using the capillary method with 22Na and 36Cl radio-tracers. The results showed that the Nernst-Einstein equation does not accurately represent the equivalent conductance of molten salts, suggesting that there are two diffusion mechanisms at play. This study provides insights into the structure of molten salts and the relations between kinetic properties and the properties of constituent ions.
